author: Staff Reporter
text:
K. Masha Nazeem of Eravipudhurkadai in Kanyakumari district, who is doing her postgraduation in engineering in S.R.M. University in Chennai, has been invited for a lecture at Nanyang Technological University’s Nanyang Technopreneurship Centre (NTC) in Singapore on March 24.

She was also invited to participate in a host of programmes organised by Singapore Science Centre and Tamil organisations in Singapore.

Earlier, she was selected for the entrepreneurial development training programme in Google, Facebook, eBay, Auto Desk and Twitter during May last year.

Ms. Masha Nazeem was among eight students selected by Motwani Jadeja Foundation (MJF), headquartered in California in the US, for the Rajeev Circle Fellowship.

She also delivered a special lecture at the 103rd Indian Science Congress held at Mysuru University for five days from January 3 this year.

Ms. Masha Nazeem started designing science projects at the age of nine and had invented 12 science models and got five national and two international awards.
title: Student invited to lecture in Singapore
